Entries.default: A cracked stone face rises from the pool. Lichens clog the hollows under its brows and nostrils, and a pale glow plays along the undersides of its cheeks.
[Inspect the pool.]
[Inspect the bones.]
[Dive toward the light.]

As murky as it is, it's difficult to tell how deep it goes. You can barely see the statue's submerged shoulders; the rest is shrouded in darkness.

Yet a smudge of light shines from the gloom.
And you hear a faint, musical sound from the depths. The melody ebbs and flows, rises and recedes.
Scattered bones lie around the pool. They're clustered around the water's edge, and despite lying in the mud, they're perfectly white.

The bones are all gleaming white and whole, without a single notch or crack. 

They're also warm to the touch. You feel a pulse running through them and quickly draw your hand back.
You leap into the pool and swim down. The water is surprisingly warm, with an oily texture and a brackish flavor.
Yet as you paddle deeper, the water grows colder. The light in the depths becomes brighter and sharper, and a strange melody murmurs through the water.
Despite the effort, you fight through the current, sustained by a deep breath and strong lungs.
The effort of swimming starts to take its toll. Your emptying lungs begin to burn.
[Continue toward the light.]
[Swim back to the surface.]

You reach the source of the light and music - a glowing conch in the statue's open hand.

Music flows from it, as rich and deep as a baritone.
You kick toward the dim glow of the surface.
You hover above it, your lungs beginning to ache.
You hover above it, your lungs screaming for air.
[Take the conch and swim back up.]

At first, the conch is stuck in place. 

With a little effort, you pry it from the statue's palm. It comes free with a pop, and the radiance and music fade. 

You push off from the statue and swim despite the pain swelling in your chest.
You kick toward the dim glow of the surface.
You emerge and climb out of the pool, enjoying deep breaths of the dank cave air.
You crawl out of the pool, heaving pained breaths after staying under so long.

You barely break through the water before gulping deep, painful breaths into your burning lungs. 

You crawl out of the pool, exhausted and weakened.
[Leave.]
[Dive toward the light.]

The bones by the pool grind and snap together. Several skeletons rise from the mud.
